gurmukhi: ਦਾਨ ਹੇਤ ਜਬ ਹਾਥ ਚਲਾਯੋ || ਨਿਕਸ ਨੀਰ ਕਰ ਤਾਹਿ ਨ ਅਾਯੋ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Daan Het Jab Haath Chalaayo|| Nikas Neer Kar Taah(i) Na Aayo||16||
translation: When the King in order to give alms took some water in his hand, no water came out of the pot.16.

gurmukhi: ਚਮਕਯੋ ਤਬੈ ਦਿਜ ਰਾਜ || ਕਰੀਅੈ ਨ੍ਰਿਪੇ ਸੁ ੲਿਲਾਜ ||
transliteration: Chamkyo Tabai Dij Raaj||dareeai Nripe Su Ilaaj||
translation: Then the Brahmin became furious and told the King to check up the por.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਨਕਾ ਮਿਲੇ ੲਿਹ ਬੀਚ || ੲਿਕ ਚੱਛ ਹੁਅੈ ਹੈ ਨੀਚ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Tinkaa Mile Eh Beech|| Ik Chchchh Huai Hai Neech||17||
translation: The pipe of the pot was searched with a straw and with this search one eye of Shukracharya was lost.17.

gurmukhi: ਤੁਨਕਾ ਨ੍ਰਿਪਤ ਕਰ ਲੀਨ || ਭੀਤਰ ਕਮੰਡਲ ਦੀਨ ||
transliteration: Tounkaa Nripat Kar Leen|| Bheetar Kamanndal Deen||
translation: The King took the straw in his hand and revolved it within the pot.

gurmukhi: ਸੁੱਕ੍ਰ ਅਾਂਖ ਲਗੀਅਾ ਜਾੲਿ || ੲਿਕ ਚੱਛ ਭਯੋ ਦਿਜ ਰਾੲਿ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Soukkra Aankh Lageeaa Jaae|| Ik Chchchh Bhayo Dij Raae||18||
translation: It pierced the eye of Shukrachraya and thus one eye of the preceptor Shukraccharya was lost.18.

gurmukhi: ਨੇਤ੍ਰ ਤੇ ਜੁ ਗਿਰਯੋ ਨੀਰ || ਸੋੲੀ ਲੀਯੋ ਕਰ ਦਿਜ ਬੀਰ ||
transliteration: Netra Te Ju Giryo Neer|| Soileeyo Kar Dij Beer||
translation: The water that oozed out from the eye of Shukracharya, the King took it in his hand.

gurmukhi: ਕਰਿ ਨੀਰ ਚੁਵਨ ਨ ਦੀਨ || ੲਿਮ ਸ੍ਵਾਮਿ ਕਾਰਜ ਕੀਨ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Kar(i) Neer Chuvan Na Deen|| Km Svaami Kaaraj Keen||19||
translation: Shukracharya did not allow the water to leak and in this way, tried to protect his master from destruction.19.

gurmukhi: ਚੱਛ ਨੀਰ ਕਰ ਭੀਤਰ ਪਰਾ || ਵਹੈ ਸੰਕਲਪ ਦਿਜਹ ਕਰਿ ਧਰਾ ||
transliteration: Chachchh Neer Kar Bheetar Paraa|| Vahai Sankalp Dijah Kar(i) Dharaa||
translation: When the water (from the eye) oozed out on the hand of the King, he gave it as alms, notionally, on the hand of the Brahmin.

gurmukhi: ਅੈਸ ਤਬੈ ਨਿਜ ਦੇਹ ਬਢਾਯੋ || ਲੋਕ ਛੇਦ ਪਰਲੋਕ ਸਿਧਾਯੋ ||੨੦||
transliteration: Ais Tabai Nij Deh Badhaayo|| Lok Chhed Parlok Sidhaayo||20||
translation: After this the dwarf expanded his body, which became so huge that it touched the heavens after penetrating through this world.20.
